page.description: The Create Linked Table dialog helps you create a linked table.

step.description: Select a type of back-end database from the Connection Type list.
Click Connect to display the Connect to Database dialog.

case.description: Navigate to and select a database in the File Name control.
Enter the other values required to access the database.
Click OK if the connection succeeded.

step.description: The default list of data sources shows only tables. Optionally, check Show Views, Show Linked Tables, and Show System Tables.
Select the remote back-end table or view that you wish to be the data source in the Table list.
Optionally, click Advanced to display the Create Linked Table - Advanced Settings dialog.
Enter the path and name of the local Alpha Anywhere table in the Local File control. You may also click to navigate to, name, or select an existing table.
